Post_Title: "You can do that when you're an adult..." All I can do as an adult is bawl my eyes out over the childhood I never was allowed to have
post_text:
I could take the physical abuse. I could take the bullying at my new school after we moved, that no one noticed until I started pulling my hair out.

I could take being responsible for my moms emotional needs. I could take her severe depression and the ever-present fear of her suicide. I could take the berating and constant scolding. I could take my ever-victim dad coming on weekends complaining about how mean my mom treats him. I could take them fighting and spitting in each other's face. I could take being forced to use my own pocket money to buy a school bag I was embarrassed to wear. I could take my mom throwing all my stuff in a pile in the middle of my room because she wasn't pleased with the way I tidied my room. I could take being treated like a piece of garbage for a large part of my childhood.

But I couldn't take that there was no one there who asked me what I wanted. Who gave a damn about how  I was feeling. Who showed just a LITTLE interest in me, other than that my heart was still beating. I couldn't take that I didn't get to do fucking normal kid things, because they were "dangerous". You rather had me clean the garage or the cellar or my room for the 3rd day in a row. 

Then, when things normalized, I was supposed to become a successful young man - "such a talented, bright boy"

My lack of "success" is my greatest fucking achievement. It was the big, nuclear middle finger in your faces and you had it coming dear parents. 

Never will I live a life you will be proud of in any way. I will always fight against the messed up world you failed to prepare me the to thrive in. You made me a rebel - after holding this shit in for almost three decades I am finally admitting the truth: you failed me.  I would have been better off without you.

I am taking things into my own hands now. I will give that inner child all the love you didn't. I will hold it lovingly until every single tear of grief has been cried. I will give it all the fun it was never allowed to have when my parents were my cruel and incompetent dictators. 

Until we both are at peace. I love you, you sweet, sweet, innocent little boy. I will never abandon you. You are my everything! This adult here will never tell you to shut up or "why the fuck are you crying, you character-pig". He will never abuse you and when you raise your arms in a defensive reflex scream "HOW DARE YOU RAISE YOUR HAND AGAINST ME?!"

Until we are both ok, that is a promise, however long it takes.
